{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3136798,"name":"Heng Yang","username":"magmawolf8","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T03:41:12.493Z","cooked":"

Our RoboRio cannot send anything over CAN bus. Here are all the pictures (we can’t embed that many)
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/16h510nXKyyuCn_ua9hDeCCRn1Caa_8FO?usp=sharing

Here is our setup right now. Please see setup.jpg

The PDH cannot detect anything by CAN bus when it is only connected to the RoboRio.
see “PDH status.jpg”

CAN bus data:
please see "potentially useful CAN data 1|2.jpg

The issue is most likely with the RoboRio because the PDH can detect a sparkMAX connected on the same CAN bus.
see “sparkMAX shown.png”

Is our RoboRio truly broken? Should we email NI, or is there a different fix?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T03:41:12.493Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":522,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":2635.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"Heng Yang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/16h510nXKyyuCn_ua9hDeCCRn1Caa_8FO?usp=sharing","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"CAN bus issues - Google Drive","clicks":63}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56766,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9114 captain"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/1","custom_user_title":"9114 captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3136816,"name":"Tauseef Afraz","username":"TFM110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T04:04:20.573Z","cooked":"

First, I’d recommend updating your firmware if you haven’t already.

Also, what is the color of the Status LED on your PDH? If it’s solid blue, then there is a issue between the connection of the PDH and Rio. If it’s solid green, you are fine.

If it is solid blue, I’d recommend first doing a continuity test of your CANbus wire between your PDH and RIO. That should tell you if their is a connection issue

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T04:04:20.573Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":43.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"Tauseef Afraz","primary_group_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39084,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/3","custom_user_title":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136822,"name":"Heng Yang","username":"magmawolf8","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T04:19:47.297Z","cooked":"

We’ve imaged the RoboRIO and everything is working perfectly except the CAN bus. The issue is that the PDH cannot detect the RoboRIO at all. It continues to flash orange and yellow.

We tried updating the firmware of everything connected. We even switched the PDH and CAN wire. The problem is most likely not with those.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T04:19:47.297Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":31.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"Heng Yang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":25570,"username":"alst","name":"alst","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alst/{size}/11646_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56766,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9114 captain"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/4","custom_user_title":"9114 captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136823,"name":"Heng Yang","username":"magmawolf8","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T04:20:40.282Z","cooked":"

It’s flashing an error code, and the “CAN fault” error seems to be an active fault rather than sticky.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T04:20:40.282Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":30.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"Heng Yang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":39084,"username":"TFM110","name":"Tauseef Afraz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56766,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9114 captain"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/5","custom_user_title":"9114 captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136827,"name":"","username":"TheJairen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thejairen/{size}/162302_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T04:31:48.793Z","cooked":"

A couple things: Do you have any code running on the Rio? Could you try a PDP? Also, I couldn’t quite tell, make sure termination is on for the PDH

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T04:31:48.793Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":33.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50221,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8248 Alumna"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/6","custom_user_title":"8248 Alumna","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136829,"name":"Heng Yang","username":"magmawolf8","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T04:39:41.131Z","cooked":"

Nothing is running on the RIO. Is the RoboRIO detected only when it’s running code actively?

We don’t have a PDP, only REV electronics provided by FIRST Grey box and one bought from REV.
Our team took out the RIO circuit board and checked for metal shards and things, but we didn’t find any. Even the resistance values seem OK. We got the termination switch on too.

Could this be a software issue? We’re using the latest firmware and image, but perhaps we need to run an autonomous program. The radio connection is fine, and RoboRIO is functioning as expected in all other respects.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T04:39:41.131Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"Heng Yang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50221,"username":"TheJairen","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thejairen/{size}/162302_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56766,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9114 captain"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/7","custom_user_title":"9114 captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136834,"name":"Tauseef Afraz","username":"TFM110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T05:00:44.265Z","cooked":"

Do you by any chance have a REV Pneumatics Hub? If so, plug that in-between the Rio and PDH and see if the status LED turns green on that. If not, it’s for sure a RIO issue, if it does turn green, it’s a PDH issue

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T05:00:44.265Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":28.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"Tauseef Afraz","primary_group_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56766,"username":"magmawolf8","name":"Heng Yang","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9e8a1a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39084,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/8","custom_user_title":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136836,"name":"","username":"TheJairen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thejairen/{size}/162302_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T05:04:55.396Z","cooked":"

You could also try the same thing with a SparkMAX and use that to view the can bus as well. I know the SparkMAX showed up on the PDH, but it’s worth trying the other way around too

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T05:04:55.396Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":87,"readers_count":86,"score":32.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":39084,"username":"TFM110","name":"Tauseef Afraz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50221,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8248 Alumna"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/9","custom_user_title":"8248 Alumna","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136838,"name":"","username":"TheJairen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thejairen/{size}/162302_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T05:07:50.459Z","cooked":"

I’m really not convinced it’d solve your issues, but you could try flashing the PDH from recovery mode too. It sometimes fixes strange problems

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T05:07:58.388Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":17.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50221,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8248 Alumna"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/10","custom_user_title":"8248 Alumna","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136846,"name":"Heng Yang","username":"magmawolf8","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T05:14:00.174Z","cooked":"

@TheJairen We did try it with a SparkMAX, and the PDH status LED turned cyan.

I connected the PCM to PDH, and now both are cyan blue. That means that the RIO has issues, correct?

edit: does this mean that we should contact NI? Will they send us a replacement? The RIO is out of stock everywhere right now.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T05:14:34.426Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":36.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"Heng Yang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":39084,"username":"TFM110","name":"Tauseef Afraz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56766,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9114 captain"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/11","custom_user_title":"9114 captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136849,"name":"","username":"TheJairen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thejairen/{size}/162302_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T05:21:06.775Z","cooked":"

This might be something that you, unfortunately, might just have to contact NI about. One more idea, what’s the resistance between the can wires if they’re only connected to the rio?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T05:21:06.775Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":79,"readers_count":78,"score":25.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56766,"username":"magmawolf8","name":"Heng Yang","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9e8a1a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50221,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8248 Alumna"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/12","custom_user_title":"8248 Alumna","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136852,"name":"Heng Yang","username":"magmawolf8","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T05:23:44.364Z","cooked":"

120 ohms. I think that’s normal.

Great, now we have our first installment in the Hall of Electronic Shame

magmawolf8:

That means that the RIO has issues, correct?

I think this is still hard to say for sure. I’m not personally familiar with PDH diagnostics, though.

Regarding code running on the roboRIO: do you have code running? I don’t mean autonomous, or enabled - just when you connect with the Driver Station software, is the “Robot Code” light green or red? If it’s red, and you haven’t deployed code to this roboRIO before, you could try deploying a sample program. No need to even enable it.

You could also check driver station logs for any errors, or see if you are getting power/current data back from the PDH (although all channels should be at 0 amps if you aren’t powering anything with the PDH, so it could be hard to tell). Log viewer instructions are here: Driver Station Log File Viewer — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

If you do end up contacting NI, you should try to go through a FRC-specific channel. I think Support - NI Community is a good place to start.

In the picture of your wiring, it looks as if the yellow can wire is attached to the bottom terminal of the can port on the roborio, which is labeled L for CAN Low. The yellow wire is the CAN High wire, and should be plugged into the top port labeled H. This would cause the error you are encountering.
This is wrong, I misremembered the order of the ports on the roborio.

","post_number":20,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-01-31T07:58:59.392Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":19,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":68,"readers_count":67,"score":18.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425195,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56766,"username":"magmawolf8","name":"Heng Yang","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9e8a1a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-detected-by-pdh-via-can-bus/425195/20","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3136992,"name":"Mark S.","username":"MarkS987","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marks987/{size}/189668_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T15:44:39.959Z","cooked":"

We have had this issue a couple of times and it looked to be wiring in our case. I would say that no matter what, check your wiring and make sure that everything is connected. I would also make sure that your SD card in the Robo RIO is in correctly and that everything is up to date. Lastly, I would say that you may want to try switching out the CAN wires for new ones, possibly ones previously used and that you know for a fact that would work.

These were the few fixes we tried as well as connected brand new motor controllers into the loop and replacing two that didn’t seem to work out. As a result, everything was up and running but it takes mistakes to learn for the future.
